name: The Blakely New York

reviews.text: We stayed 4 nights at the end of March. From the minute we arrived to the time we checked out, everything went smoothly. We were in a one bedroom suite, which consisted of a bedrooms with two large beds and a living room with a single bed. Both areas has TV's and DVD players, which worked out nicely. My kids watched a movie they brought with them and we watched our own program in the bedroom. There was a desk and chair and a comfortable chair with ottoman in the bedroom as well. The kitchenette area was definitely a plus. I knew they had Keurig coffeemakers, so I brought some hot chocolate for my children. The hotel supplied complimentary coffee, decaf and tea for the Keurig, which was replaced daily. The mini fridge/freezer came in handy as did the microwave. We called down three different times during our stay for ice and towels and within minutes, they were at our door!
reviews.title: Everything about it is great!
Incredible value in New York City
reviews.text: I found no problems with the free internet and the hotel has a computer in the lobby where you can print out boarding passes, etc. I even used it to print out some tickets to Madame Tussaud's. The elevator speed had been vastly improved and the complimentary continental breakfast was great. It consisted of coffee/tea, cereals, breads, muffins and fresh fruit. My kids were even satisfied!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Location couldn't be better. Less than one block from the subway station for N,R,Q trains. We used the system a lot to get around everywhere. Also the hotel is within a few blocks of Times Square, Broadway and around the corner from Central Park. Trust me when I say you do not want to stay right in the Time Square area, unless you like noise and endless people in front of your hotel!
reviews.title: Great hotel in a perfect location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: When we checked out and had an evening flight, the bellman held our bags until our car came. All in all a fantastic hotel and experience!
reviews.title: Terrific Stay in NYC

reviews.text: Really an amazing bargain for under $300 per night in a great midtown location. We had two one bedroom suites. Each includes a king size bed, day bed, tiny kitchenette and bath. The amenities are good for a hotel at this price point. Service was personal and friendly with the bellman doubling as concierges and very helpful and warm. The elevators are cramped and old but function fine. There are about 8 rooms per floor. The included breakfast is the major weak point. It's basically stale pastries, yogurt a couple of fruit selections and some bagels. The coffee was awful. Skip breakfast and go down the street to a diner! We normally stay at much higher end hotels so I am unusually critical and tough but this hotel is a great deal for someone who is out and about in New York sightseeing, in for theater etc.
reviews.title: Great location and rooms

reviews.text: It is on the same street as the St Regis, and around the corner from the London NYC, the Ritz Cartlon and the Pensinsula. It is also around the block from the Moma, and two blocks from Central Park. with Madison Ave, Fifth Ave on the doorstep. And the subway to downtown across the Street.The Blakely has location.
reviews.title: Brillant. 8 Days and we wanted more!

likes.liked: — Space Location Great Staff and Style and also that is was a small hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It also has brillant staff who make the place run effortlessly.
reviews.title: An Oasis in NY

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is not a five star, and that was just perfect.It was like living in a small intimate club, where you did not have to mingle with the guests and where everything was of a high quality from the Penhaligon toiletries, to the glassware ,the bed, the drapes, the flatscreen TV's and wireless internet access.
reviews.title: good hotel for first-timers & frequent visitors to NYC

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had a 1 bedroom suite and it felt like having your own apartment in Manhattan with maid service. The delis nearby made living extremely easy, and we would simply not go anywhere else in New York again. If you want trendiness and action then perhaps this is not the place for you. If you want comfort, efficency and space with a touch a of quiet style then you will not be disappointed. A great experience.
reviews.title: Enjoyed our Stay

reviews.text: This was our first trip to NY and had agonised over which hotel to stay in.We considered the usual suspects, but decided to go for a smaller hotel with a bit of character.How pleased we were that we chose the Blakley. Although on first impressions the outside is a little dowdy, once inside it is a peaceful ,calm , oasis.
reviews.title: Love the location, inadequate air-conditioning in one-bedroom suites.

reviews.text: Overall, the hotel was a good stay. The positives - the staff are extremely attentive and friendly (pushing the elevator button in advance, pleasant at check-in and check-out, helping our stroller in and out of the building), the room was clean, and we got a suite there with a second room with door so that our toddler could sleep in peace and quiet while we had guests over (FANTASTIC and worth paying extra money for), and the location is fantastic - five minute walk to central park, and we couldn't hear our neighbors the entire stay even though the hotel was fully booked. The negatives are that we exepcted a more up-to-date room for $315/night but I am aware that we may not be adequately comparing it with other rooms in NY city and instead with San Fran rooms at that rate a night. The room has older (but beautiful) carpets and older-style furniture and we are used to more contemporary rooms. The other minus was that during 'rush hour' the elevators can take a good 5-10 minutes to arrive and so we ended up taking the stairs on more than one occasion. So the net is that if it costed less, we would definitely stay again, but at that rate I would try another hotel in the area.
reviews.title: Readjust expectations for NY hotel?
Web Only Rate was best value we could find in the area on short notice
reviews.text: A relative recommended the Blakely. The hotel is clean and modern & the kitchenette was handy. The bathroom is done in marble, but the towel rack, makeup mirror, and electrical outlets were located above the toilet. Yuck! (see photo) Management suggested a $2 per person tip for pouring coffee at the "complimentary" continental breakfast. The food was high quality, but selection was limited. Breakfast opens at 7:30, so we missed it on the last day due to an early flight. Street noise was not a problem. Our 10th floor room faced away from 55th Street & the air conditioner ran almost constantly which masked street noise. I did not hear any sounds from adjacent rooms. The staff was not particularly gracious, but they met our needs.

I stayed in the Blakely for several nights in June 2010. It was a very positive experience. The rooms are large (for NYC) and clean and even feature a kitchenette. The hotel offers free wifi which is a great plus and free breakfast. On the Sunday breakfast was very busy and they ran out of most things when I was there, which is to be expected with a complimentary breakfast. Staff was friendly. The location is fantastic and I will definitely stay there again.
reviews.title: Pleasant hotel

reviews.text: I loved this hotel....large clean rooms, free breakfast, great staff, good location for touring the city..would highly recommend.
reviews.title: What a gem.............

reviews.text: Everyone was so welcoming and friendly with the personal touch. Nothing was too much trouble. The rooms were very clean, the beds were really comfortable and the bathroom was lovely with all the marble. The power shower was just what was needed, with the temperature being in the 90's. The complimentary breakfast in the Abbocato was delicious and the service there was first-class as well. I am planning a return trip as soon as possible and would rather stay there again instead of anywhere else.
reviews.title: Perfect place to stay, right in the middle with easy access to everywhere

reviews.text: This was one of the best hotels I have ever stayed in. Brilliant location, 10 minute walk to Central Park and Times square and many other sights. The room was spacious and very clean and a good continental breakfast was available. The staff were really helpful.
reviews.title: SUPERB HOTEL

reviews.text: The elevator was the only negative as it was very small and slow, I would recommend you walking the stairs if you room is on the first 3 floors.
reviews.title: Fantastic

reviews.text: Would definately stay here again.
reviews.title: loved this hotel

reviews.text: The Blakely is an extremely pleasant hotel that my friend and I enjoyed very much. The staff were extremely attentive. The location was great, walking distance to central park and times square. There was a free basic breakfast included which was great. It is probably for older people, perhaps couples. The design of the hotel is very classic and elegant. Whilst I am quite young, I still enjoyed my stay!
reviews.title: Could be perfect with just one improvement!

reviews.text: Location was absolutely wonderful. its like having your own highrise condo in the heart of the city.
reviews.title: Nicest Hotel EVER!!!

reviews.text: I spent 3 nights at the Blakely in November. I didn't get in to the hotel until 1 in the morning, and I was up to my room within 90 seconds. I stayed in room 206, which unfortunately had no view at all, but was very nicely appointed in every other way. I loved the hardwood floors in the entrance foyer, as well as the wet bar, microwave, and mini-fridge (even thought I didn't use any of them, it was nice to know that they were there). The king size bed was very comfortable, and there was also an arm chair with ottoman, and a desk as well. For a New York hotel room, it didn't seem small at all. The perceived spaciousness continued into the bathroom, with mirrors placed on three sides of the room opening it up. The bathtub was very large too, and it was even a jacuzzi tub.
reviews.title: Comfortable, warm, and a great location.

reviews.text: There were two minor gripes I had: one, the door to the room was quite thin, so sound traveled in easily, and two, the pillows were very flat, and only one extra pillow was provided in the closet. Other than that, the room was extremely comfortable.
reviews.title: Great base for NYC

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The lobby was very comfortable as well, cozy even. They provided a computer and printer for guest use, and wi-fi is free throughout the hotel. I didn't look at the fitness center, but it was nice to know that it is open 24 hours. There is a free continental breakfast next door, but I didn't eat there any of the mornings.
reviews.title: Good hotel but disapointing service in the restaurant

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Because my trip to my hometown was for business, I was in meetings during the day and with friends/family at night, so I didn't really get a chance to spend much time at the Blakely. It's too bad, because I really liked the hotel. My room was paid for by my company, so I don't know how much it would of cost, but the location can't be beat, and it really does have a sense of warmth that makes it a very nice place to come back to. I look forward to staying at the Blakely again.
reviews.title: Great location, friendly staff, good service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: When you go on holiday, the last thing you need is a Hotel that gives you the blues. This hotel certainly did not do that for me or my family. We never gave the place a second thought, which is how it should be.
reviews.title: Great Hotel Good Location

reviews.text: We just spent 4 nights at the Blakely and found it to be an excellent choice. Rooms and location are excellent, you think you are miles away from any life but the reality is it is a few hundred yards away. The staff are top rate, they are friendly, knowledgeable and helpful. Recommended without hesitation. Even my kids loved it and nothing pleases them.
reviews.title: Wonderful

likes.disliked: — Person next door slammed his door at around midnight each night. Pain ita.Need door closers fitted.

reviews.text: My husband and I stayed at the Blakely for one week this July and had a fantastic experience. The room was extremely comfortable and quiet, the staff always friendly and helpful, and the location was excellent. The feeling of the hotel is small, personal and somewhat like a special hotel in London. We were exceptionally happy with our experience, and also strongly suggest you eat at the restaurant associated with the hotel. The service was outstanding and the food was spectacular. We are critical travelers, and will definitely return to the Blakely whenever we go to New York.
reviews.title: the Blakely is a wonderful small, mid-town hotel

reviews.text: Our family of 4 recently returned from a 2 night stay at the Blakely Hotel ( 2 kids 8 & 11)- We Loved our stay! Perfect location- close to central park, times square, subway yet far enough away so to escape all the craziness! With a family of 4 the 1 bedroom suite was awesome- plenty of room for all at we felt a great price for NYC. The staff was very friendly- we will be back!!!
reviews.title: Our Family Loved the Blakely

likes.liked: — 1 bedroom suite- enough space for a family of 4 & great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: What a Great Hotel! Stayed in a one bedroom King suite which was ample room for A NYC hotel room. Although I agree with other reviewers, the lighting in the bathroom was a little dim. The staff was extremely curteous- checking and holding our bags for us since we arrived earlier than check in. Also, holding our bags for us the next day after we had checked out. One of the TV's in our suite was not working and was fixed within a half hour. It is quiet at night but still close enough to all the hot spots in the city.
reviews.title: Loved The Hotel-Skip the American Buffet (Highway Robbery)

likes.liked: — Location, size of room for price

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I am an extremely light sleeper and did not wake up once.
reviews.title: Pleasantly Surprised

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the Blakely for 8 nights at the end of April/beginning of May. I wasn't certain that this hotel was the best choice for us, but I was proved wrong. The downstairs lobby, though small, was charming, and we loved the library motif throughout the hotel. We even had shelves of hardback books in our room.
reviews.title: Loved our stay

reviews.text: We were in room 1401, a one-bedroom suite, which was quite large. The bedroom overlooked 55th Street and was quite comfortable--many drawers for storage as well as a large closet. The bed was comfortable, and the linens were changed daily. I have become used to white duvets on hotel beds and was somewhat unnerved by the brownish gold one on our bed. However, I accidentally got a black mark on it--and the next morning we had a clean duvet, so for those who worry about colored duvets/bedspreads, there is no need to fret about it at the Blakely. We ran the ac/heating system fan all night, and we also always travel with a white noise machine. As a result, we heard nothing during the night or early morning to disturb our sleep.
reviews.title: Well sited boutique hotel with helpful staff and large rooms

reviews.text: The living room was rather dark--no windows, but it had a daybed as well as two comfortable chairs. There is a large closet in this room as well, so we had more than enough storage space. The microwave and small refrigerator came in handy--with dishes provided, such as silverware, glass ware (including wine glasses), plates, etc.
reviews.title: Excellent hotel in prime location

reviews.text: The bath is small, but modern and immaculately clean. One wall is mirrored as well as the usual mirror over the vanity and a full length mirror on the door. The lighting is strange, however. Many overhead lights would seem to produce ample lighting for a small bathroom; the way they're arranged, though, instead produce shadows and make it difficult to apply makeup, fix hair, etc.
reviews.title: Great price, friendly staff & lots of attention to detail

reviews.text: The free wifi in the room is a definite plus for this hotel. Sometimes it proved to be a little quirky and slow, but it is free and doesn't cost $14.95 per day as it did in the other hotel we seriously considered. I have read many complaints about the two elevators. We didn't find them to be overly slow. We did have to wait a bit sometimes for an elevator, but we were on the 14th floor and didn't really see the small wait as a problem. The elevators are small and did remind us of similar elevators in European boutique hotels. After all, we've had to wait on elevators in large chain hotels.
reviews.title: My favorite place to stay in New York

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Such a great hotel, it really befits its excellent location. Thus:
reviews.title: Loved it!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: 1.Classy, comfortable, well-equipped rooms (I loved the ipod dock and coffee machine)
reviews.title: Wonderful Surprise

reviews.text: 2. Safe and homely atmosphere
reviews.title: family break in new york

reviews.text: 3. Great restaurant next door
reviews.title: What a Great Boutique Hotel

reviews.text: 4. Helpful staff, including the doorman
reviews.title: Not good enough

reviews.text: I did a lot of research before booking this hotel. We stayed 7 nights, and were travelling with our 2 children (11 & 8 years). After reading all the reviews, I was still unsure what to expect and to be honest, I have mixed feelings about our stay, but have come to realise that these were largely due to the attitude of the attached restaurant (which the hotel relies on for breakfast/room service).
reviews.title: Fantastic location and hotel, shame about the restaurant.

reviews.text: On arrival we were advised our room would be 45 mins (it was around 1.15pm), which wasn't a problem as there are many nearby restaurants to have lunch. The front desk advised this was one of their largest rooms (we had booked a suite). When we returned, we were shown to a room on the 3rd floor which overlooked a brick wall and a bank of air conditioning units (right outside the window, which sounded like a 747 taking off....and this was during the day). Before they could bring the bags up, we rang and asked if there was anything else available. Given we had booked in advance, directly with the hotel and paid full asking price, I felt they could have done a better job accommodating us. To their credit, Front Desk rang back within minutes advising us there was nothing with 2 Queen beds(which we had requested), but they had a room with 2 Double beds at the front of the hotel (overlooking the street). This room was on the 2nd floor, so the street noise was occasionally an issue, but a much better option than the 747:) ....there were also no cockroaches in sight (as per a previous review). I asked if we could have an extra rollaway bed (we didn't want to share smaller beds with the kids) and this request was immediately sorted out without a problem. All in all, we were really happy with the room (lots of space) and the beds are as comfortable as everyone reports. As we were on 2nd floor (and lobby is 1st floor), we were unaffected by the elevator situation and used the stairs.
reviews.title: Very nice.....

reviews.text: The location is fantastic, and we walked everywhere. Occasionally we used the MET/bus, but mostly grabbed cabs in order to visit family on UWS. A few days it poured with rain, but the hotel provides large umbrellas (complete with bowler hat logo - very cute) which we greatly appreciated. The concierge is fantastic, and although we are pretty independent travellers, they are happy to chat and ask about your day and if you need any help (the stretch limo they helped us arrange as a surprise for the kids was a big hit).
reviews.title: Lovely Hotel :)
Location Can't Be Beat!
reviews.text: The downside....the restaurant. It's wasn't so much the food - just the attitude! We didn't have breakfast until after 9.30am on the four mornings we used the restaurant to avoid "the rush". Depending on which waiter you got made a huge difference. Sometimes we got coffee, sometimes we didn't.... The choices were basic and never changed, but it was ok. On our last morning, given we were flying from JFK back to Sydney, I wanted everyone to eat well, so asked my husband to order eggs (while I was finishing the last minute packing). I rushed to get downstairs, thinking the eggs would be going cold, but they had not arrived......and did not arrive! After watching another patron receive her cooked breakfast, my husband enquired if ours would be long. We were completely unimpressed when the Waiter apologised that he had "forgotten" our order. My husband was still relaxed about the situation, thinking he would fix it, but I knew what was coming....sorry the kitchen is closed now (because we had waited so long), so bad luck, there's a restaurant down the street.... On a previous occasion, we were all really tired after a very long day, and just wanted to go back to the hotel and use room service. I asked the lady who answered if there were any kids meals - "no, we don't do that". She suggested pasta with butter if we wanted something plain, and also advised they had pizza with diced tomato etc on it as a "special". When I enquired if we could just have ham on the pizza (ham was on the menu in some kind of sandwich) she sharply stated, "we are busy with theatre patrons, so the kitchen won't do anything not on the menu", so after agreeing to the pasta, she basically hung up on me! It was the worst service we got on our entire trip. The spaghetti arrived, swimming in butter and was awful. Thank goodness we had gone to Wholefoods and stocked up on fruit etc. If you want a decent breakfast go to Carnegie Deli. You'll pay for it, but just the experience is worth it (people taking photos of their huge sandwiches) etc. Another quick option is to run up to Starbucks (on the corner of 7th Ave) and grab coffee and muffins, or Fluffy's.

The restaurant situation would not have been an issue if we had not been travelling with kids, my husband and I would have just gone elsewhere (no matter how tired we were). However if you want something with a bit of flexibility that caters in some small way to children, avoid going here! Other than that, I would thoroughly recommend staying here over a large hotel - it really is "New York".
reviews.title: COCKROACHES
great hotel
reviews.text: We just returned from a girls weekend in the city and stayed here. It was a perfect size and location. The staff made us all feel comfortable and welcome.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stay at Four Seasons and Hyatts all the time, but this time, visiting NYC, we decided to downscale a little. The suite we stayed in (#908) was a great surprise.
reviews.title: Clean, Quiet, Roomy, Midtown, Everything

reviews.text: The suite, which included a little living room with flat screen TV and a little coffee nook, was larger than we expected for NYC.
reviews.title: Love the Blakely! But Skip the Restaurant:(

likes.liked: — Location, staff, room size, very comfortable beds, charming atmosphere
likes.disliked: — Poor bathroom lighting, elevators can be slow at times

reviews.text: It was completely up to date, with marbel floors and granite countertops. Clean as a whistle. The shower was the best I have ever had. No restrictors on here.
reviews.title: I Challenge You To Find A Better NYC Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The bed was perfect and the room also had a larger flat screen TV.
reviews.title: Calm in the chaos

reviews.text: We recently spent a week in Manhattan to explore the city. Our seven year old chose NYC as her preferred destination and wanted to see all of the sites. I read many reviews online and wanted a hotel that offered a little more space for our family of three plus my mother. One standard hotel room would not be enough for the week. While space comes as a premium in Manhattan, along with a premium price, the Blakely was a great value. Our suite gave us a way to have separate rooms with a generous bathroom and microwave and fridge as well (though half the fridge was full of mini bar temptations). The two TVs, comfortable beds and furniture provided us a very nice home for the week. We had to ask once to have the TV remote batteries replaced and for extra towels, and the hotel staff responded promptly and in a friendly manner to our requests. There is a breakfast included every morning at the hotel's restaurant Abboccato,. It is only a continental breakfast of bagels, small pastries, cereal, yogurt and fresh fruit, which served us just fine. I would like to see an additional offering of protein; even if it was hard boiled eggs or some cheese. The breakfast service is a little confusing in that much of it is self-serve, though the waitstaff appear to be in charge of pouring coffee and hot water, but at busy times are struggling to keep up with busing dishes and restocking foods. They are friendly and competent, but sometimes leaves the guest to wonder which items are self-serve and which are not. The 24/7 concierge service was very helpful and everyone went out of their way to provide us with personal service. The Blakely is a terrific mid-town option, and if I was going to stay again just steps from Times Square, Rockefeller Plaza, 5th Avenue, and Central Park, I would not hesitate to make the same choice.
reviews.title: Excellent location, family-friendly

reviews.text: Great location between Central Park and Times Square, huge room complete with chairs to sit in rather than sitting on the bed, continental breakfast, microwave and fridge in the room, excellent desk staff to answer any of your questions. The restaurant Abboccato is as good as the hotel
reviews.title: Friendly, comfortable midtown hotel

reviews.text: The best thing about this hotel is its location. It is a short walk from central park and great for Lincoln Centre and Carnegie Hall and theatres. Their are also some great restaurants in the same street. The hotel has an old style charm and rooms are comfortable and well equipped.
reviews.title: Old style comfort

reviews.text: The bathrooms have a bath with adjustable jet shower (although not suited to people with disabilities) all kept spotlessly clean by the housekeeping staff.
reviews.title: Fantastic Hotel

reviews.text: Each room has a tv, safe and a hair dryer, ironing board and iron, an alarm clock with i-pod/phone dock to charge and listen to your music.
reviews.title: Great value in a great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Blakely Hotel
reviews.title: Nice hotel, great location, several problems to work out though

likes.disliked: — bed linens, ability to handle emergencies, housekeeping, maintenance

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: New York, New York
reviews.title: Excellent value

reviews.text: We stayed at the Blakely Hotel for 3 nights, and it was a roller coaster ride. We arrived after a red-eye and needed to sleep at 10:00 AM. We had told the hotel we would need a room early if at all possible. The night before, we called the hotel to verify our request, and the Concierge told us the hotel was not booked and it looked good for us when we arrived early.
reviews.title: Great Hotel

likes.liked: — The suite was spacious and spotless.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: However, upon arrival, the first staffer who heard our plight told us no one could check in before noon. But then a second staff said to wait, and she found us a room. We felt lucky she was around to try to accommodate.
reviews.title: Outstanding!

reviews.text: The rooms are beautiful with a small flat screen TV, refrigerator, microwave, tiny kitchenette with full table service for two. The pink marble tub was nice, with a freestanding sink (no room to lay out your bathroom stuff).
reviews.title: Great Hotel with Awesome Location

likes.liked: — Suite was spacious and location was great

description: Midtown Hotel with traditional exterior located in heart of business, shopping & theater districts.
